maggi masala.name: Hostel Special Maggi
steps: Heat oil in pan, add chopped onions and green chilies
Add tomatoes and cook until soft
Add water and bring to boil
Add maggi noodles and masala packet
Cook for 2-3 minutes, add garam masala and serve hot
maggi masala.hostel_tip: Add an egg while cooking for extra protein! No veggies? Just use the masala packet.

poha.name: Classic Poha
steps: Rinse poha in water and drain well
Heat oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves
Add chopped onions, cook until golden
Add turmeric and drained poha
Mix gently, add salt and cook for 3-4 minutes
poha.hostel_tip: No curry leaves? Skip them! Add peanuts for crunch if available.

bread omelette.name: Hostel Bread Omelette
steps: Beat eggs with salt, chopped onions and chilies
Heat oil in pan
Pour egg mixture and place bread slice on top
Flip when bottom is cooked
Cook other side and serve hot
bread omelette.hostel_tip: Use a non-stick pan if available. Add cheese slice for extra taste!

chapati pizza.name: Chapati Pizza
steps: Spread tomato sauce on chapati
Add chopped onions and capsicum
Sprinkle grated cheese on top
Heat in pan with lid covered for 5 minutes
Sprinkle oregano and serve
chapati pizza.hostel_tip: No oven needed! A pan with lid works perfectly. Use any leftover chapati.

paneer butter masala.name: Quick Paneer Butter Masala
steps: Fry paneer cubes in butter until golden
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft
Add cream, garam masala and kasuri methi
Mix paneer into sauce and simmer for 5 minutes
Serve hot with chapati or rice
paneer butter masala.hostel_tip: No cream? Use milk with a spoon of ghee. Frozen paneer works too!

dal tadka.name: Simple Dal Tadka
steps: Pressure cook dal with turmeric and salt
Heat ghee, add cumin seeds
Add onions, cook until golden
Add tomatoes, cook until soft
Mix cooked dal and simmer for 5 minutes
dal tadka.hostel_tip: Pressure cooker saves time! No ghee? Regular oil works fine.

aloo paratha.name: Stuffed Aloo Paratha
steps: Boil and mash potatoes with spices and chilies
Make dough with atta and water
Roll dough, stuff with potato mixture
Seal and roll again carefully
Cook on tawa with oil until golden both sides
aloo paratha.hostel_tip: Leftover boiled potatoes work great! Serve with curd or pickle.

egg curry.name: Hostel Egg Curry
steps: Boil eggs and peel them
Heat oil, add onions and ginger-garlic paste
Add tomatoes and spices, cook until thick
Add little water to make gravy
Add boiled eggs and simmer for 5 minutes
egg curry.hostel_tip: Pre-boil eggs when you have time. Tastes better the next day!

rajma.name: Quick Rajma
steps: Soak rajma overnight and pressure cook
Heat oil, add cumin seeds and onions
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes
Add cooked rajma with its water
Add garam masala and simmer for 10 minutes
rajma.hostel_tip: Use canned kidney beans to save time! Mash few beans for thick gravy.

upma.name: Vegetable Upma
steps: Dry roast semolina until aromatic
Heat oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves
Add onions and chilies, cook until soft
Add 2 cups water and salt, bring to boil
Slowly add roasted semolina while stirring
upma.hostel_tip: Keep stirring to avoid lumps! Add any vegetables you have.

khichdi.name: Comfort Khichdi
steps: Wash rice and dal together
Heat ghee, add cumin seeds
Add rice-dal mixture and turmeric
Add 4 cups water and salt
Pressure cook for 3-4 whistles
khichdi.hostel_tip: Perfect comfort food when sick! Add vegetables for nutrition.

curd rice.name: South Indian Curd Rice
steps: Cook rice and let it cool
Mix rice with beaten curd and salt
Heat oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves
Add green chilies and pour over rice
Mix well and serve
curd rice.hostel_tip: Great for hot weather! Add chopped cucumber for crunch.

besan chilla.name: Protein-Rich Besan Chilla
steps: Mix besan with water to make smooth batter
Add chopped onions, chilies, coriander and spices
Heat oil in pan
Pour batter and spread like pancake
Cook both sides until golden
besan chilla.hostel_tip: High protein breakfast! Serve with chutney or ketchup.

masala chai.name: Perfect Masala Chai
steps: Boil water with ginger and cardamom
Add tea leaves and boil for 2 minutes
Add milk and sugar
Boil until desired color and strain
Serve hot
masala chai.hostel_tip: Use tea bags if no loose tea. Adjust milk and sugar to taste.

bhel puri.name: Quick Bhel Puri
steps: Mix puffed rice with chopped onions and tomatoes
Add both chutneys as per taste
Mix well and top with sev
Garnish with coriander
Serve immediately
bhel puri.hostel_tip: Buy ready-made chutneys to save time! Eat quickly before it gets soggy.

pasta masala.name: Indian Style Pasta
steps: Boil pasta with salt until cooked
Heat oil, add onions and capsicum
Add tomatoes and garam masala
Add tomato sauce and cooked pasta
Mix well and cook for 3 minutes
pasta masala.hostel_tip: Any pasta shape works! Add cheese if available for creaminess.

sandwich.name: Bombay Sandwich
steps: Boil and slice potatoes
Slice cucumber, tomato and onion
Apply butter and green chutney on bread
Layer vegetables between bread slices
Grill in sandwich maker or pan
sandwich.hostel_tip: No sandwich maker? Use a heavy pan to press down while cooking!

lemon rice.name: Tangy Lemon Rice
steps: Cook rice and let it cool
Heat oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves
Add peanuts and fry until golden
Add turmeric and pour over rice
Add lemon juice and mix gently
lemon rice.hostel_tip: Use leftover rice! Add more lemon for extra tang.

aloo tikki.name: Crispy Aloo Tikki
steps: Boil and mash potatoes
Mix with spices, chilies and coriander
Shape into patties and coat with bread crumbs
Shallow fry until golden brown
Serve hot with chutney
aloo tikki.hostel_tip: Make extra and freeze for later! Tastes great with ketchup too.

vegetable pulao.name: One-Pot Vegetable Pulao
steps: Soak rice for 30 minutes
Heat ghee, add whole spices and onions
Add vegetables and fry for 5 minutes
Add rice and water (1:2 ratio)
Cook covered until rice is done
vegetable pulao.hostel_tip: Use frozen mixed vegetables to save chopping time!
